glosses: Genoa (a port city and comune, the capital of the Metropolitan City of Genoa and the region of Liguria, Italy)
Genoa (a metropolitan city of Liguria, established in 2015; in full, the Metropolitan City of Genoa)

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish جنوه (Cenova), from Italian Genova directly and via Persian جنوآ (Jenoâ), from Latin Genua, as the city was known by the ancient Ligurians; probably from the Ancient Ligurian word for “knee”, from Proto-Indo-European *ǵnéwo- (“knee”), a thematic derivative of Proto-Indo-European *ǵónu, in this sense “angle”, from its geographical position.
